org.apparatus_templi.driver

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.driver.Driver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlankControllerDriver, BlankSensorDriver, DbTester, DbTester2, DoorLock, DoorSensor, Echo, EmailTester, FancyWidgetTest, LargeCommands, LazyDriver, LedFlash, LightSwitch, MotionGenerator, MotionWatcher, MotionWatcherTest, MotorTester, SetTopBox, SleepyDriver, StatefulLed, TempMonitor, TestDriver, TwitterTester, XmlTest

    public abstract class Driver
extends Object
implements Runnable
    An abstract class for a basic driver.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

    • Field Detail

      • name

        protected String name
        The unique name of this driver. This name should match the name of the remote module it corresponds with, and must be 10 characters or less.

      • isRunning

        protected volatile boolean isRunning
        Indicates whether or not this driver should continue running, or begin its termination process. If the driver executes in a continuous loop after loading, then it should check the status of this flag before every loop.

      • queuedCommands

        protected volatile Deque<String> queuedCommands
        A queue of commands that were sent to this driver while it was TERMINATED. The status of each driver is determined by its Thread.State. If a driver is terminated then any incoming messages will be placed in this queue before the driver is restarted. Each driver should check (or clear) this queue within its run() method. If the driver runs continuously then this queue will not be used.

      • queuedBinary

        protected volatile Deque<byte[]> queuedBinary
        A queue of data that was sent to this driver while it was TERMINATED. The status of each driver is determined by its Thread.State. If a driver is terminated then any incoming messages will be placed in this queue before the driver is restarted. Each driver should check (or clear) this queue within its run() method. If the driver runs continuously then this queue will not be used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Driver

        public Driver()

    • Method Detail

      • receiveCommand

        public abstract boolean receiveCommand(String command)
        Sends a command to this drivers remote module. This is the interface that the front-ends use to control each remote module. It is up to each driver to check the incoming command for validity before calling Coordinator.sendCommand(Driver, String)
        Parameters:
        command - the command to send to the remote module.
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether the command was received and not malformed. The return value will be used by the web server to determine whether to return HTTP_OK or an error status in the connection headers.

      • receiveBinary

        public abstract boolean receiveBinary(byte[] data)
        Sends binary data to this drivers remote module. This is the interface that the front-ends use to control each remote module. It is up to each driver to check the incoming data for validity before calling Coordinator.sendBinary(Driver, byte[])
        Parameters:
        data - the command to send to the remote module.
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether the command was received and not malformed. The return value will be used by the web server to determine whether to return HTTP_OK or an error status in the connection headers.

      • getWidgetXML

        public abstract String getWidgetXML()
        Returns a String of XML data representing a widget view of this driver. The widget data should be a compact view of all sensor data or controller commands available, or full data from a limited set of sensors or controllers.
        Returns:
        a String of XML widget data.

      • getFullPageXML

        public abstract String getFullPageXML()
        Returns a String of XML data representing a full view of this drivers data and capabilities. This XML data should be a detailed view of all the sensors data or controller commands available.
        Returns:
        a String of XML data.

      • terminate

        public final void terminate()
        Notify the driver that it should begin terminating. More specifically sets the boolean flag isRunning to false. Drivers should query this flag periodically to know when to begin their termination procedure (if any).

      • getModuleName

        public final String getModuleName()
        Returns the unique String name of this driver.
        Returns:
        the name of this driver.

      • queueCommand

        public final void queueCommand(String command)
        Places the String command into the Driver's command queue
        Parameters:
        command - the command to enqueue

      • queueBinary

        public final void queueBinary(byte[] data)
        Places a block of binary data into the Driver's data queue
        Parameters:
        data - the data to enqueue

      • readQueuedCommand

        protected final String readQueuedCommand()
        Pull the front-most element from the command queue
        Returns:
        the head of the command queue, or null if there are no more commands to process

      • readQueuedBinary

        protected final byte[] readQueuedBinary()
        Pull the front-most element from the data queue
        Returns:
        the head of the data queue, or null if there are no more data blocks to process

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return the short (10 character or less) name of the driver.

      • setName

        protected final void setName(String newName)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the drivers name to the given name
        Parameters:
        newName - the new name to assign to this driver.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given name is null or is longer than 10 characters.

      • sleep

        protected final void sleep()
        Places this driver into a blocking state until it is woken by the Coordinator. After entering this state the Driver will remain BLOCKED until an incoming message address to this driver is received, or until the service is stopping, whichever comes first. The blocking will only affect the execution of the Runnable.run() method.

      • sleep

        protected final void sleep(long sleepPeriod)
        Places this driver into a blocking state until it is woken by the Coordinator or until its sleepPeriod has expired. After entering this state the Driver will remain BLOCKED until an incoming message address to this driver is received, or until the service is stopping, or until its sleep period has expired, whichever comes first. The blocking will only affect the execution of the Runnable.run() method.
        Parameters:
        sleepPeriod - the length of time in milliseconds that this driver should block.

      • wake

        public final void wake()
        Wakes this driver if it is in a sleep period, does nothing otherwise.
